GT.content: question of the “come” of the “come back” will invaginate, efface, all borders, will redouble endlessly ambivalence of gift as good or bad, gift or poison (Gift-gift)
GT.linkedContent: question of the “come” of the “come back” will invaginate, efface, all borders, will redouble endlessly ambivalence of gift as good or bad, gift or poison (Gift-gift)

H.content: proper name in its pure possibility: it’s to you yourself, I say: “come,” “enter”
H.linkedContent: proper name in its pure possibility: it’s to you yourself, I say: “come,” “enter”

LOBL.content: chose has always signified, in philosophy, that which doesn’t arrive > hupokeimenon or rēs, substance to which accidents happen, not only its accident
LOBL.linkedContent: chose has always signified, in philosophy, that which doesn’t arrive > hupokeimenon or rēs, substance to which accidents happen, not only its accident

LOBL.content: its very not-happening happens to the “Come” in its pas de chose, procès, as arrêt de mort that can’t be decided, neither life nor death
LOBL.linkedContent: its very not-happening happens to the “Come” in its pas de chose, procès, as arrêt de mort that can’t be decided, neither life nor death

LOBL.content: sur-vient, the event, Nietzsche’s Doppelgänger, ghosts, consists in nothing but coming about, being gone
LOBL.linkedContent: sur-vient, the event, Nietzsche’s Doppelgänger, ghosts, consists in nothing but coming about, being gone

LOBL.content: apocalypse, eschatology, the “last War,” the “context” of l’arrêt de mort > “come” is said to event that comes about, apocalyptic superimprinting of texts
LOBL.linkedContent: apocalypse, eschatology, the “last War,” the “context” of l’arrêt de mort > “come” is said to event that comes about, apocalyptic superimprinting of texts

LOBL.content: “come”: single word, yet intertwined in series, inscribes its own effacement in middle of and on invaginated boundaries of récit, of these crypts, death or bridal chambers, hymen brings alliance & separation [after theft of key]
LOBL.linkedContent: “come”: single word, yet intertwined in series, inscribes its own effacement in middle of and on invaginated boundaries of récit, of these crypts, death or bridal chambers, hymen brings alliance & separation [after theft of key]

LOBL.content: “and” as arrêt de mort, “and” of double bind, and I say “come,” “and immediately"-writing, annihilates time in ring of eternal return, yokes affirmation to itself in récit, the being-at-the-same-time of the other beyond time
LOBL.linkedContent: “and” as arrêt de mort, “and” of double bind, and I say “come,” “and immediately"-writing, annihilates time in ring of eternal return, yokes affirmation to itself in récit, the being-at-the-same-time of the other beyond time

LOBL.content: in Blanchot’s L’arrêt de mort, 2 women, 2 voices w/out voice, tele-phone each other: “come” > how do we read this unreadable hymen? it takes place as unreadable, from bottom of crypt in which it remains > it will have taken place where it remains: that’s the proof
LOBL.linkedContent: in Blanchot’s L’arrêt de mort, 2 women, 2 voices w/out voice, tele-phone each other: “come” > how do we read this unreadable hymen? it takes place as unreadable, from bottom of crypt in which it remains > it will have taken place where it remains: that’s the proof

PAS.content: yes, yes: force of affirmative repetition, unique call of the to-come as the will to repeat itself, affirmation that cites itself, joyous EROS, immeasurable unhappiness, irreducible contamination, affirmation risks citation, le oui qui fait dans la langue un trou aussi étrange que viens, il approuve, affirme, contresigne tout ce “qui est arrivé”
PAS.linkedContent: yes, yes: force of affirmative repetition, unique call of the to-come as the will to repeat itself, affirmation that cites itself, joyous EROS, immeasurable unhappiness, irreducible contamination, affirmation risks citation, le oui qui fait dans la langue un trou aussi étrange que viens, il approuve, affirme, contresigne tout ce “qui est arrivé”

PAS.content: who is there? what can respond to viens? dislocated unity of as such, an affirmation that says yes not to a being but to what/who is to come again, there is no incompatibility, contradiction, but no dialectic, no reconciliation
PAS.linkedContent: who is there? what can respond to viens? dislocated unity of as such, an affirmation that says yes not to a being but to what/who is to come again, there is no incompatibility, contradiction, but no dialectic, no reconciliation

PAS.content: Blanchot’s récit as new thought of citation acc. EROS, repetition of yes that begins by doubling itself, récit unscathed, unique force of a viens that never reproduces itself: viens —sauf
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot’s récit as new thought of citation acc. EROS, repetition of yes that begins by doubling itself, récit unscathed, unique force of a viens that never reproduces itself: viens —sauf

PAS.content: both affirmation and contaminated as a citation
PAS.linkedContent: both affirmation and contaminated as a citation

PAS.content: viens calls itself, calls the call, w/ no specular reflection, gives no order, receives no order from law of laws, exchanges nothing, not a prayer, desire, demand
PAS.linkedContent: viens calls itself, calls the call, w/ no specular reflection, gives no order, receives no order from law of laws, exchanges nothing, not a prayer, desire, demand

PAS.content: question of viens, question of tutoyer, questions everything [familiarity] w/out totalizing, je voudrais que tu t’approches lentement de ce dont il y va dans ce viens
PAS.linkedContent: question of viens, question of tutoyer, questions everything [familiarity] w/out totalizing, je voudrais que tu t’approches lentement de ce dont il y va dans ce viens

PAS.content: Venez: an authoritarian, an intimate word; violence kept at furthest distance, furthest distance is near
PAS.linkedContent: Venez: an authoritarian, an intimate word; violence kept at furthest distance, furthest distance is near

PAS.content: “Viens” upsurges (surgit) from a groundless ground (fond sans fond) of an indefinite past
PAS.linkedContent: “Viens” upsurges (surgit) from a groundless ground (fond sans fond) of an indefinite past

PAS.content: Venez says the provocation of a pas
PAS.linkedContent: Venez says the provocation of a pas

PAS.content: Derrida proposes we hear Blanchot’s viens, a coming back w/out memory (le sous-venir sans mémoire), in Heidegger’s Ereignis
PAS.linkedContent: Derrida proposes we hear Blanchot’s viens, a coming back w/out memory (le sous-venir sans mémoire), in Heidegger’s Ereignis

PAS.content: “Go (Va)” says the same thing as viens, moves away at same pas, towards a place w/out passage, toward a living (vivre) qui vaut “peut-être même mourir”
PAS.linkedContent: “Go (Va)” says the same thing as viens, moves away at same pas, towards a place w/out passage, toward a living (vivre) qui vaut “peut-être même mourir”

PAS.content: to say “Viens” in quotation marks, le “Viens,” that which we cannot avoid is missed, mais on court la chance de répéter l’alliance ——what i would like to give you: Viens w/out language overhang (sans aucun langage de surplomb), w/out anything that could name it, designate it from a third place
PAS.linkedContent: to say “Viens” in quotation marks, le “Viens,” that which we cannot avoid is missed, mais on court la chance de répéter l’alliance ——what i would like to give you: Viens w/out language overhang (sans aucun langage de surplomb), w/out anything that could name it, designate it from a third place

PAS.content: simulacrum of circle, EROS, the double pas, he/it that says viens inaugurates it by responding déjà
PAS.linkedContent: simulacrum of circle, EROS, the double pas, he/it that says viens inaugurates it by responding déjà

PAS.content: viens calls la mort de l’autre, venue de l’autre, who calls and names itself
PAS.linkedContent: viens calls la mort de l’autre, venue de l’autre, who calls and names itself

PAS.content: repetition of yes, yes, allies one yes to other, refolds the other, gives sens to a singularity that should have none > viens never arrives because of this repetition
PAS.linkedContent: repetition of yes, yes, allies one yes to other, refolds the other, gives sens to a singularity that should have none > viens never arrives because of this repetition

PAS.content: affirm viens w/out possible return or as eternal return of the other
PAS.linkedContent: affirm viens w/out possible return or as eternal return of the other

PAS.content: it is not the meaning of viens but the pas de sens that thwarts the closure of language
PAS.linkedContent: it is not the meaning of viens but the pas de sens that thwarts the closure of language

PAS.content: Viens, at the same time unique and copy (exemplaire), Blanchot’s récits as exemplary citations, their unique power is that the unscathed possibility of unique (le sauf) remains in reserve from which “I would emerge” to say, to one of them,“Viens”
PAS.linkedContent: Viens, at the same time unique and copy (exemplaire), Blanchot’s récits as exemplary citations, their unique power is that the unscathed possibility of unique (le sauf) remains in reserve from which “I would emerge” to say, to one of them,“Viens”

PAS.content: viens doesn’t give place to any order, w/out law, w/out anything namable that may be desired, demanded from a lack
PAS.linkedContent: viens doesn’t give place to any order, w/out law, w/out anything namable that may be desired, demanded from a lack

PAS.content: double pas, before, beyond all time, resounds in viens, stairway scene, un pas de marche, w/out figure that disappears in it, w/out representation
PAS.linkedContent: double pas, before, beyond all time, resounds in viens, stairway scene, un pas de marche, w/out figure that disappears in it, w/out representation

PAS.content: the one who says “I” depends by his name, in his identity, on terrifyingly ancient event of another viens, le même pourtant > the drowned (noyé) as the one who says “I”
PAS.linkedContent: the one who says “I” depends by his name, in his identity, on terrifyingly ancient event of another viens, le même pourtant > the drowned (noyé) as the one who says “I”

PAS.content: the call of death precedes me, it is death and the word (mort/mot) that’re called in the viens > I call myself dead, marcher in my name > w/out name before viens
PAS.linkedContent: the call of death precedes me, it is death and the word (mort/mot) that’re called in the viens > I call myself dead, marcher in my name > w/out name before viens

PAS.content: to say viens to a unique word (parole), somewhat plural (un singulier sauf à être plurielle), to say “Come” to her, that word, is to sacrifice right to call (appeler) another and say you to him [?]
PAS.linkedContent: to say viens to a unique word (parole), somewhat plural (un singulier sauf à être plurielle), to say “Come” to her, that word, is to sacrifice right to call (appeler) another and say you to him [?]

PAS.content: Blanchot’s tutoieing (viens) breaks w/ indiscreet familiarity, not negative theology, but describes its law, its jurisdiction, its perversion > can say toi w/out tutoieing [& reverse]
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot’s tutoieing (viens) breaks w/ indiscreet familiarity, not negative theology, but describes its law, its jurisdiction, its perversion > can say toi w/out tutoieing [& reverse]

PAS.content: near depthless abyss in mise en scène of “Viens”
PAS.linkedContent: near depthless abyss in mise en scène of “Viens”

PAS.content: wanting (le vouloir) to break fascination always effect of fascination? why break it? I love and desire fascination, any desire w/out it? [tu me fascine, je t’aime]; viens, word of fascination, defers in difference what it cannot break with—dare that another dissimulation not come
PAS.linkedContent: wanting (le vouloir) to break fascination always effect of fascination? why break it? I love and desire fascination, any desire w/out it? [tu me fascine, je t’aime]; viens, word of fascination, defers in difference what it cannot break with—dare that another dissimulation not come

PAS.content: at the indistinct edge of sea, viens said just once between us
PAS.linkedContent: at the indistinct edge of sea, viens said just once between us

PAS.content: must be able to reject the gift, vomir ce qui t’appelle à dire viens, forget in order to reject the poison, to not guard the gift
PAS.linkedContent: must be able to reject the gift, vomir ce qui t’appelle à dire viens, forget in order to reject the poison, to not guard the gift

PAS.content: when I say viens, I scream (hurle) and hold back (retiens) a murmur no one can hear
PAS.linkedContent: when I say viens, I scream (hurle) and hold back (retiens) a murmur no one can hear

PAS.content: death, the other name of viens (both only reach the other)
PAS.linkedContent: death, the other name of viens (both only reach the other)

PAS.content: must forget the question of your self, of your uniqueness, and love viens, the unique, not a name, not an impersonal infinitive
PAS.linkedContent: must forget the question of your self, of your uniqueness, and love viens, the unique, not a name, not an impersonal infinitive

PIO.content: invention of tout autre beyond possible status, still invention because one prepares to let the other come > deconstruction is that which gets ready for the coming of the other (deconstructs this double genitive) > to invent: to “know” how to say “come” and answer “come” of other
PIO.linkedContent: invention of tout autre beyond possible status, still invention because one prepares to let the other come > deconstruction is that which gets ready for the coming of the other (deconstructs this double genitive) > to invent: to “know” how to say “come” and answer “come” of other

HST.content: hôte always passing through, iterability, come, come back
HST.linkedContent: hôte always passing through, iterability, come, come back

ATAP.content: Derrida didn’t know when he wrote Pas that “Viens” came from John Patmos
ATAP.linkedContent: Derrida didn’t know when he wrote Pas that “Viens” came from John Patmos

ATAP.content: “Come” precedes & calls event, opens scene, no theme, supports no metalinguistic citation, not an order, not a prayer, not obscurantism—just beyond “What is?” > perhaps where Ereignis and Enteignis unfold movement of propriation
ATAP.linkedContent: “Come” precedes & calls event, opens scene, no theme, supports no metalinguistic citation, not an order, not a prayer, not obscurantism—just beyond “What is?” > perhaps where Ereignis and Enteignis unfold movement of propriation

ATAP.content: “Come” doesn’t try to lead, can always be appropriated: “I am in the act of seducing you” can always increase seduction > “Come” can always lead back higher than itself toward conductive violence, toward authoritarian “duction”
ATAP.linkedContent: “Come” doesn’t try to lead, can always be appropriated: “I am in the act of seducing you” can always increase seduction > “Come” can always lead back higher than itself toward conductive violence, toward authoritarian “duction”

ATAP.content: it is une dérive, absolutely derivable only from the other—not derivable from an appropriable identity, from what’s already derivable & arrivable—w/out “rive” (source, spring, rivus)
ATAP.linkedContent: it is une dérive, absolutely derivable only from the other—not derivable from an appropriable identity, from what’s already derivable & arrivable—w/out “rive” (source, spring, rivus)

ATAP.content: apocalypse w/out apocalypse, w/out Last Judgment, no eschatology beyond tone of “Come” itself > the apocalypse of apocalypse [our apocalypse now], beyond good & evil: no longer collection of evil & good in legein of alētheia, in Geschick of l’envoi, or of Schicken of co-destination
ATAP.linkedContent: apocalypse w/out apocalypse, w/out Last Judgment, no eschatology beyond tone of “Come” itself > the apocalypse of apocalypse [our apocalypse now], beyond good & evil: no longer collection of evil & good in legein of alētheia, in Geschick of l’envoi, or of Schicken of co-destination
